Reviews.Content: a great location I have just come back from staying at the Electra building, home to the Seattle Suites it was our second visit and we stayed there 2 years ago. It's a great place to feel at home with a taste of living in the city and not just visiting a hotel. The penthouse appartment that I stayed in with a friend was only slighty more money than the normal suite, as there was an extra bathroom. The views were excellent over a section of the city. The reception staff were very friendly and there is a nice mixture of appartment owners and visitors. We did have problems with the locals knowing where exactly it was as the road is tucked away. The location is great for downtown and close to a local supermarket for supplies. The only downside was the intense heat in the building despite turning down the heating as much as possible the building heats up so much that you need to have the windows open nearly all the time which can make things noisy. All in all a great place to stay.
Reviews.Author: nm838

Reviews.Content: We Were Impressed I found the hotel by chance, while looking on the Internet for another near the Washington Convention Center in Seattle, and the three of us who stayed there at Seattle Suites for four days feel very lucky to have found it. WEBSITEFirst off, the website was navigable and useful in the info it provided. Expecially compared to those of the chain hotels around the convention center, the website provided very detailed information about the rooms, including how many beds and what type were in each room. This was important for the three of us, as no one wanted to share a bed or sleep on a living room sofa-bed. The best feature is the room availability chart.BUILDINGI agree with the previous reviewer that the building is showing it's age, and the hallway sometimes smelled of whatever was cooking; however, it also has personality/style, even in the retro decor of the little lobby that seemed to be recently renovated.THE ROOMSEach suite is really a condo that's being used now for short-term rentals. As such, our suite felt like a house, not a hotel. The furniture was great, and, I suspect, particular to each room - very comfy leather couches, good-quality heavy wood furniture, Persian-style rugs on the wood living room floor, etc. Wired and wireless Internet was included, too. We were surprised that in addition to the standard dishes and cookingware in the kitchen, it was also stocked with a heavy-duty coffee maker, coffee grinder, and new bag of good beans in the fridge. We began each day Seattle-style, by brewing VERY strong coffee. Again, it was much more like staying at a friend's apartment than a hotel.OTHEROne negative point: Since we were on the freeway side of the building, we could hear the drone of cars through the closed windows when the room was quiet. However, the walls were thick, and we never heard a neighbor. The close proximity to the convention center (5-minute walk to the convention center lobby), the personal welcome  care by owner Doug, and the amazing homey amenities of the suite far outweighed anything against staying there. I would absolutely stay there again and again, as would my roommates.
Reviews.Author: BB-from-SB

Reviews.Content: Nice place for a family of 4 We stayed on the 8th floor of the Electra Condo Building, Condo 809. This building is a street up from the Seattle Conference Center on Pike Street and Hubbel, just off of 7th street. This is a great location to be if you are hanging out in the city. We could walk to most places in central Seattle. We were 4 blocks from the monorail and 8 blocks up from the pike street market. This was a nice secure building, not quite as deluxe as the photos, but not bad. We stayed as a four person family with 2 teens and had enough room.
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLibrarian

Reviews.Content: Awesome Accommodation Our visit to Seattle was a blast, highlighted by our warm, wonderful and homey condo from Seattle Suites. Our one bedroom had a plush and comfy bed you hardly want to get out of. There's a huge wrap around sofa in the living room with a large double bed sleeper. The Suites are right in downtown Seattle next to the Washington Convention Center and an easy walk to incredible shopping, including a 5-10 minute stroll to the Pike Place Market and only minutes more to the waterfront and ferries! Westlake Mall, Nordstrom's, the monorail (to the Seattle Center and EMP) and other great venues are even closer! And just a quickee free bus ride to Safeco and Qwest Field. There are theatres, restaurants and museums within easy walking distance. Also there are views of the city from the room and even greater ones from the rooftop access. Would recommend Seattle Suites to anyone traveling to Seattle!!!
Reviews.Author: Millsmurph

Reviews.Content: What an amazing location, amazing opportunity From the outside apperance it seems like you are going into an apartment complex. Even the units are named apartments on the door. But in reality these are aparments that were turned into condos a while ago. So what you are doing is actually renting a condo that is located in the middle of Seattle overlooking the Convention Center.The unit I stayed in was a 2 bedroom unit with a fabulous marble bathroom. The furnishings I experienced had a faux leather couch and all brand new beds (still could see the tags.) So I assume that maybe this one was just recently upgraded to the 2 unit the other reviewer stayed in. I did notice that there were quite a few other condo owners when I came in so it seems that this is a place that is well taken care of and it is not a rental hotel experience. It's something a bit more. It's like a home away from home.This place had a kitchen, complete with dishes, and they even supplied coffee, which seems appropriate given it is Seattle. The art even seemed like it wasn't everyday stuff you find in all other hotels/motels. You basically have the keys to someone's home that becomes yours as soon as you walk in.Wireless interent just worked as I opened my laptop. Cable TV/DVD was available from the remote. And there was even a TV supplied in the bedroom.I can't say enough about this place. If you want to have a five star, every whim given to you (as well as every tip expected!!) then you should try something far more epensive like the Fairmont, but if you want to have a great place, great location (walkable to everything downtown,) with a more relaxed atmosphere then this is the place!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: The apartment was good, but the building shows its age       View of Freeway Park  Convention Center access
Reviews.Author: CaptainBristol

Reviews.Content: Deserves serious consideration Perfect alternative to a hotel room - anyday! Was in Seattle for a week and to be able to come home after work and have plenty of creature comforts, space and privacy at a competitive cost made for a perfect stay. The apartment was very clean and really exceeded my expectations. The roof top terrace is a must for grand views of the city. Staff are very accommodating as well. Full service grocery store within blocks, so you can stock up for those quick breakfasts or late night snacks. Nothing better than grinding fresh beans and brewing a pot of coffee when you wake up to start your day. I'd definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good but not Luxurious We paid $175/nt for a 2bd/1ba unit. I thought that was a great price for peak season. All units are individually owned, and therefore each one unique. Our unit looked very different than website photos. Kitchen was dated and not so clean. Bathroom was dated. We also traveled with children, so maybe they purposefully put us in modest unit. There was a portable A/C unit in the living area, and fans in the bedrooms. The building is historic, possibly like ones 1st apt during college.The location is great, easy walk to downtown sites. But with a new all suite hotel next door....humm if I could do it over, I'd skip 1400 Hubbell and opt for something on Pike.
Reviews.Author: lichtfamily

Reviews.Content: Home Away From Home Seattle Suites was the perfect spot to stay. There were four of us, high school friends, celebrating our 50th birthdays. It was very comfortable, homey, great views, close to shopping and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: very pleased I have stayed at the Seattle Suites for 3 years now on business trips to Seattle and have found the place superb for the price. It is in an older building but the Suites them selfs are very clean and taken care of. The suites are comfortable and do have nice city views. the location is awsome for Seattle entertainment seeing how its basically in the center of downtown. The furniture is new and the beds are comfortable. I would recommened Seattle Suites for business or pleasure.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Comfort Access Space I have been in Seattle on extended business, from the east coast, since August 2004, and have stayed at the Seattle Suites the entire time.My suite is spacious and well appointed. It feels like home rather than a hotel. My suite has TV with cable in the main living area and in the bedroom. There are phones in both rooms as well. There is a fully furnished kitchen with all of the conveniences like a full range stove, microwave, dishwasher, dishes and other kitchenware. There is an elegant glass dining table and tall stools for the kitchen counter.The building is located right in the center of all the action in Seattle. You have ease of access to downtown and, in the other direction, to the hip Capitol Hill neigborhood with tons of art galleries, shops and restaurants.The building is very secure; with a closed circuit, TV system and a concierge. In addition to the concierge, I was given the phone number of a Seattle Suites staff member for any assistance. Any requests that I have made have received an immediate response.Seattle is an amazing city and the suite, location and service of Seattle Suites has made my stay here exceptional.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: TERRIBLE PLACE TO STAY The seattle suites were way over rated. The place was VERY VERY DIRTY. I was never told that the unit did not have AIR CONDITIONING. This is in insane. I have never stayed in a place with no A/C. It was very hot and sticky. The place was also very very very very dirty. Looked like the place has never been cleaned correctly, the carpet was dirty. There was hair visible on the floors and the place STUNK. The hallway to the room was absolutely absurd!! The hallway fumes could be smelled all the way to the elevator. IT SMELLED OF URINE. I would not recommened this place to anyone. I will NEVER stay here again!! I was told that the place was emmaculate. I dont know there definition of emmaculate, because it was FILTHY.
Reviews.Author: ROSEAUSTIN

Reviews.Content: over rated Booked this very over rated two room with no real view for New Years 2004. The building is old, smelly and dank. The dark back ally was filled with garbage. The noise from the road outside is loud. I tried to get out of the room, but we ended up dealing with it. I feel we were greatly overcharged, even with the free coffee. The parking was an extra $73 dollars for 4 days. You more or less have to -- and park down 6 floors in the garage next door, because there is no where else safe/close to park. The parking around the building requires a permit, and the toll parking has to be paid every 2 hours until 7 am then you have to leave. I was charged the room rate, plus a heavy tax, PLUS extra room charge per person per night -- which I was told at check in was still not enough (but they let me slide?!). It was close to downtown - I'll give it that much, but not much else. The bed sheets and pillows had slobber and some other type of stains on them. The kitchen was not clean, had a dingy rug and dirt in the corners. It was OK but I would of rather taken my $210+ per night and stayed in a really great hotel with free parking and house keeping. I am disapointed with this stay.
Reviews.Author: lass=

Reviews.Content: Home Away from Home Went to Seattle and when we were let down with Hotel booking got Seattle Suites at the last minute. It was a home away from home which provided everything we needed including an iron, a TV, video, phone, art and Seattle books, comfy pillows, a coffee maker, and kitchen in a condo setting. They even left us some Seattle coffee to get us going. It was comfy, homey, and more than we could have asked for with the host manager like your brother meeting you at the door.Would highly recommend to anyone who wants to be on their own timetable, terms, and clock. Location was great - within a stone's throw from the Convention Center and downtown.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
